required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tomivosertib (eFT-508) in Combination With PD-1/PD-L1 Inhibitor Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Tomivosertib (eFT-508) in Combination With PD-1/PD-L1 Inhibitor Therapy: A Study of Subjects Administered Anti-PD-1/Anti-PD-L1 Therapy That Are Experiencing Insufficient Response to Checkpoint Inhibitor Alone

brief_summary.textblock: Phase 2, open-label study that will evaluate the safety, tolerability, antitumor activities.

detailed_description.textblock: This Phase 2, open-label study will evaluate the safety, tolerability, antitumor activity, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of Tomivosertib (eFT-508) in subjects who have initiated anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 monotherapy and either developed progressive disease (PD) per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1 on therapy or have undergone 12 weeks of anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 therapy with no evidence of partial response (PR) or complete response (CR).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will continue their anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 therapy, which they had already initiated per standard of care according to the package insert, and then initiate Tomivosertib (eFT-508) at 200 mg twice daily (bid) 7 days prior to their next scheduled anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with treatment-emergent AEs (TEAEs) and serious AEs (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of TEAEs and SAEs will be summarized and TEAEs will also be summarized by severity and according to their relationship to Tomivosertib (eFT-508).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) as determined by RECIST 1.1
primary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of subjects who achieve a best overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR).

primary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) as determined by RECIST 1.1
primary_outcome.description: Defined as the interval from the start of Tomivosertib (eFT-508) to the occurrence of PD or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of subjects who achieve a best overall response of CR assigned using iRECIST (iCR) or PR assigned using iRECIST (iPR).
Defined as the interval from the start of Tomivosertib (eFT-508) to the occurrence of confirmed progression assigned using iRECIST (iCPD) or death from any cause.
Defined as time from the first dose date of Tomivosertib (eFT-508) to death due to any cause will be summarized.

arm_group.description: Tomivosertib (eFT-508) will be taken at 200 mg twice daily (bid). Subjects will continue their anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 therapy, which they had already initiated per standard of care according to the package insert.

intervention.description: Tomivosertib (eFT-508) is a novel, small-molecule investigational drug being developed by eFFECTOR Therapeutics, as an antitumor therapy that acts by selectively inhibiting mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK)-interacting serine/threonine kinase (MNK)1 and MNK 2.

facility.name: Indiana University Health Melvin & Bren Simon Cancer Center
University of Wisconsin Clinical Science Center
